Package brickdestroy.brick

Class Brick

java.lang.Object
brickdestroy.brick.Brick
Direct Known Subclasses:
CementBrick, ClayBrick, ColorBrick, SteelBrick
public abstract class Brick
extends java.lang.Object
The Brick Class refers to a singular brick we see above the game. Refactoring - The "Crack" class that was nested into the Brick Class has been refactored to a singular Class outside of Brick to break down this large class into a smaller one and so that its purpose is more clear. The private static variable Random rnd has been moved to Crack class as there is no point using a getter for this variable in order to access it from Crack class since it is not being used here at all. Moving it to Crack removes the need to use a getter here or there. The Brick Class consisted of an unused variable called MIN_CRACK, this has been removed to increase understanding and readability of the code. Removed "name" variable from Brick as it is not being used since it has no contribution towards the project. The Shape "brickFace" variable has been made private and encapsulation has been used to get the shape of the brick face using a getter method called getBrickFace() to access from other classes. Converted the IMPACT variables to private and used getters to access for the GamePlay class to promote encapsulation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Brick

      public Brick​(java.awt.Point pos, java.awt.Dimension size, java.awt.Color border, java.awt.Color inner, int strength)
      This is the constructor for Brick Object.
      Parameters:
      pos - The top-left position of the brick.
      size - The Dimension of the brick (width and height)
      border - The outer color of the brick.
      inner - The inner color of the brick.
      strength - The strength of the brick (How many impacts it can handle).

  • Method Details

    • makeBrickFace

      protected abstract java.awt.Shape makeBrickFace​(java.awt.Point pos, java.awt.Dimension size)
      This method is used to make the face of the brick (Rectangle).
      Parameters:
      pos - The top left position (coordinates) of the brick.
      size - The width and height of the brick (Dimension).
      Returns:
      Returns Rectangular Shape of the brick face.

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact​(java.awt.geom.Point2D point, int dir)
      This method handles strength reduction of bricks on impact. It also checks if the brick is broken.
      Parameters:
      point - Refers to the edge of the ball making contact with the brick.
      dir - Refers to the direction (edge) of the brick that is making contact with the ball.
      Returns:
      Returns boolean value based on whether the brick makes or not.

      public static int getUpImpact()
